biolockj.module

Class SeqModuleImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.SeqModuleImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, ScriptModule, SeqModule, Comparable<BioModule>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AwkFastaConverter, BuildQiimeMapping, ClassifierModuleImpl, Gunzipper, KneadData, PearMergeReads

    public abstract class SeqModuleImpl
extends ScriptModuleImpl
implements SeqModule
    Superclass for SeqModules that take sequence files as input for pre-processing prior to classification.

      • getSeqFiles

        public List<File> getSeqFiles(Collection<File> files)
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: SeqModule
        Return only sequence files for sample IDs found in the metadata file.
        If Config."metadata.required" = "Y", an error is thrown to list the files that cannot be matched to a metadata row.
        Specified by:
        getSeqFiles in interface SeqModule
        Parameters:
        files - Module input files
        Returns:
        Module sequence files
        Throws:
        Exception - if no input files are found

      • isValidInputModule

        public boolean isValidInputModule(BioModule module)
        Description copied from class: BioModuleImpl
        In the early stages of the pipeline, starting with the very 1st module ImportMetadata, most modules expect sequence files as input. This method returns false if the previousModule only produced a new metadata file, such as ImportMetadata or RegisterNumReads. When BioModuleImpl.getInputFiles() is called, this method determines if the previousModule output is valid input for the current BioModule. The default implementation of this method returns FALSE if the previousModule only generates a new metadata file.
        Specified by:
        isValidInputModule in interface BioModule
        Overrides:
        isValidInputModule in class BioModuleImpl
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule that ran before the current BioModule
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if the previousModule output is acceptable input for the current BioModule
